meanings.sent1: I picked a juicy huckle from the bush.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed a basket of huckles during the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nibbled on the huckle and made a funny face.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as red as a ripe huckle in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The huckle tasted like a burst of sweetness in my mouth.

meanings.sent1: I had to huckle down to tie my shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: She had to huckle to reach the low shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to huckle under the bed but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to huckle under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: He had to huckle over to see what was on the other side.

meanings.definition: A strap or rope used to secure a load on a vehicle
meanings.sent1: The truck driver tightened the huckle around the boxes.
meanings.sent2: The huckle kept the furniture secure in the moving van.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy chewed through the huckle and caused a mess.
meanings.sent4: The huckle held everything in place like a trusty friend.
meanings.sent5: She tied a neat knot in the huckle to keep the package safe.
